data.title: Office of Federal Financial Management
data.meta_description: The Chief Financial Officers Act (CFO) of 1990 created OFFM as the Executive Branch’s focal point in a framework for more effective Federal financial management. OFFM responsibilities include implementing the financial management improvement priorities of the President, establishing government-wide financial management policies of executive agencies, and carrying out the financial management functions of the CFO…
data.text:
The Chief Financial Officers Act (CFO) of 1990 created OFFM as the Executive Branch’s focal point in a framework for more effective Federal financial management. OFFM responsibilities include implementing the financial management improvement priorities of the President, establishing government-wide financial management policies of executive agencies, and carrying out the financial management functions of the CFO Act.

OFFM’s mission is to develop and implement coordinated policy with Federal Chief Financial Officers to assure that Federal financial management practices support effective delivery of service across the United States Federal government.

Resources and Other Information
